title: Plug in
text: Plug in the values for the equation. Choose a point to be the $$x_2$$ and $$y_2$$ pair, and use the other as the $$x_1$$ and $$y_1$$ pair. We get $$\sqrt{{\left(-3-\left(--1\right)\right)}^2+{\left(4-\left(-2\right)\right)}^2}=\sqrt{40}$$.

title: Simplify
text: Simplify the answer into one term. $$\sqrt{40}=\sqrt{4\times10}=\sqrt{4} \sqrt{10}=2\sqrt{10}$$
